canSelectArbitrarily().Description: Returns true if this movement method allows arbitrary selection of any text; false if it has no selection (like a movement method that only scrolls) or a constrained selection (for example limited to links. The "Select All" menu item is disabled if arbitrary selection is not allowed.

Returns: True if the event was handled.
Parameters: int: The keyboard meta states used for movement.
handleMovementKey(android.widget.TextVie.Description: Performs a movement key action. The default implementation decodes the key down and invokes movement actions such as @B_android#text#method#BaseMovementMethod#down_E@ and @B_android#text#method#BaseMovementMethod#up_E@. @B_android#text#method#BaseMovementMethod#onKeyDown_E@ calls this method once to handle an @B_android#view#KeyEvent#ACTION_DOWN_E@. @B_android#text#method#BaseMovementMethod#onKeyOther_E@ calls this method repeatedly to handle each repetition of an @B_android#view#KeyEvent#ACTION_MULTIPLE_E@.
handleMovementKey(android.widget.TextVie.FullName: protected boolean handleMovementKey (TextView widget, Spannable buffer, int keyCode, int movementMetaState, KeyEvent event)

ClassDesc: A movement method that provides cursor movement and selection. Supports displaying the context menu on DPad Center.
